intro: Adicea inaequalis, commonly known as the unequal adicea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Adicea inaequalis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
